title: (x) Looking for a vintage 30s script - similar to Trafton Script {Paul H}
content:
Hi Everybody

I’m doing a project on Vintage clothes shops and I’d like to work with Thirties fonts. Many ads of the time used a script font like this one. Any ideas what it may be called?

Thanks

Clinton

 [‹ (x) $1 - Signature Black {Mike}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084105/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13227 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Monocase Graphic-exchange Print logo - FF Disturbance {Florian, Jan E} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084105/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44008 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cisfor

comments.content:
Sorry can’t seem to upload the file...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084105im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/2_6606.jpg)

That’s better
i’m not sure you’ll find many like this. this seems to sit somewhere between the delicate Trafton Script and the sturdier scripts represented by Magneto.
Thanks Paul. Trafton Script is perfect for my needs.
oops! [Coronet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706084105/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=coronet&x=0&y=0) was the one I was thinking of.
